alert.note: Alert for Thurston (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 02 at 12:52PM PST until March 02 at 11:04PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Skookumchuck River Near Bucoda affecting Thurston County. .Hydrologically significant rain came to an end Tuesday. Rain in the next couple of days will not result in any changes to the river levels. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Skookumchuck River Near Bucoda. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 213.0 feet, the Skookumchuck River in Thurston County will flood several residential and business areas around Bucoda. Flood waters will cover many roads * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:00 PM PST Wednesday the stage was 212.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:00 PM PST Wednesday was 214.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this afternoon and continue falling to 206.4 feet early Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 211.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this evening at 900 PM PST.
